heroicTraits.effect: If this unit is in combat, roll a dice. On a 3+, this unit can immediately use the ‘Retreat’ ability as if it were your movement phase without any mortal damage being inflicted on it.

heroicTraits.name: The Clammy Hand
heroicTraits.lore: This boss is obviously destined for great things and can call upon vast troglodytic hordes.
heroicTraits.effect: Each time a friendly GLOOMSPITE GITZ unit wholly within 12" of this unit uses the ‘Rally’ command, you can make 3 additional rally rolls of D6.

heroicTraits.name: Loontouched
heroicTraits.lore: This warlord’s magical prowess is boosted by the Bad Moon’s light.
heroicTraits.effect: If this unit is not a WIZARD, it has WIZARD (1). Otherwise, add 1 to casting rolls for this unit.

other.name: Taktikal Cowering
other.lore: Snerk can usually be found hurling insults from behind his mate’s solid, regenerating body.
other.effect:
While the Loonboss in this Regiment of Renown is within the combat range of the Dankhold Troggoth in this Regiment of Renown:

• That Loonboss has WARD (4+).
• Each time you make a successful ward roll for that Loonboss, allocate 1 damage point to that Dankhold Troggoth after the damage sequence for that Loonboss has been resolved (ward rolls cannot be made for those damage points).

other.name: Go Dat Way!
other.lore: Snerk makes sure to give his troggoth mate a jab if they get distracted. Which they do. Often.
other.declare: Pick the Dankhold Troggoth in this Regiment of Renown to be the target if it is within 12" of the Loonboss in this Regiment of Renown.
other.effect: For the rest of the turn, the target can still use CHARGE abilities even if it used a RETREAT ability in the same turn.

other.name: Ambush Time!
other.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle (Army), Your Movement Phase
other.lore: At a howl from their Snarlboss’s alpha wolf, the Shinestealaz launch their attack, pelting towards the weak spots in the enemy line.
other.declare: Pick all units in this Regiment of Renown if they are prowlin’ around.
other.effect: Set up those units anywhere on the battlefield more than 9" from all enemy units.

other.name: Sneaky Prowlin'
other.lore: Letting their temporary allies grab the majority of the foe’s attention, the Shinestealaz circle around the flanks.
other.declare: Pick all units in this Regiment of Renown if none of them have been deployed.
other.effect: Set up those units in reserve prowlin’ around. They have now been deployed.

other.name: On Da Moon's Trail
other.lore: Skulkrik and his grots are constantly on the hunt for signs of the Bad Moon’s last position, and they will become extra stubborn and stabby when defending sites touched by their god’s light, lest the trail go cold.
other.effect: The melee weapons of units in this Regiment of Renown have Anti-charge (+1 Rend) while they are contesting an objective you control.

other.name: Sneaky Distraction
other.lore: The shaman’s unnaturally shrill cries and magical light-show hypnotically draw the attention of their foes.
other.declare: Pick the Gobbapalooza in this Regiment of Renown to cast this spell, then make a casting roll of 2D6.
other.effect: Until the start of your next turn, subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks made by enemy units while they are wholly within 12" of the caster.

other.name: Sudden Emergence
other.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Movement Phase
other.lore: Braggit and his ladz tend to turn up wherever they are least expected (and least desired).
other.declare: If the Rabble-Rowza in this Regiment of Renown is in a super-secret tunnel, pick it to be the target.
other.effect: Set up the target anywhere on the battlefield more than 9" from all enemy units. Then, set up all other friendly units that are in a super-secret tunnel within 3" of the target and more than 9" from all enemy units.

other.name: Super-Secret Tunnels
other.lore: Rabble-Rowzas have a knack for locating hidden passages beneath the earth.
other.declare: Pick a unit in this Regiment of Renown that has not been deployed.
other.effect: Set up that unit in reserve in a super-secret tunnel. It has now been deployed.

battleTraits.name: The Faces of the Bad Moon
battleTraits.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle Round (Army), Start of Battle Round
battleTraits.lore: The Bad Moon hurtles erratically around the realms in madcap orbits, empowering its worshippers and troubling all others with insane visions.
battleTraits.declare: You must use this ability at the start of the battle round. If multiple players are commanding a Gloomspite Gitz army, then instead, at the start of the battle round, those players roll off and only the winner declares and uses this ability this battle round.
battleTraits.effect: If it is the first battle round, pick the starting face of the Bad Moon (Grinnin’, Scowlin’, Sulkin’ or Cacklin’). If it is not the first battle round, the face of the Bad Moon moves to the next face in the sequence.

battleTraits.name: Under the Light of the Bad Moon
battleTraits.lore: Grots are always vicious little monsters, but depending on the face of the moon, they can become an order of magnitude more dangerous.
battleTraits.effect:
During the battle, the effects below apply to friendly GLOOMSPITE GITZ units based on the current face of the Bad Moon:

Frothing Zealots: While the Bad Moon is Cacklin’ or Grinnin’, add 5 to the control scores of friendly non-SQUIG MOONCLAN units.

Spiderfang Venom: While the Bad Moon is Cacklin’ or Grinnin’, combat attacks made by friendly SPIDERFANG units score critical hits on unmodified hit rolls of 5+. This also affects Companion weapons.

Moonlit Hide: While the Bad Moon is Grinnin’ or Scowlin’, subtract 1 from the Rend characteristic of combat attacks that target friendly TROGGOTH units.

Lunar Squigs: While the Bad Moon is Scowlin’ or Sulkin’, instead of rolling the dice to determine the Move characteristic of a friendly SQUIG unit, you can use a value of 4.

Sneaky Snarlfangs: While the Bad Moon is Sulkin’ or Cacklin’, friendly GITMOB units can use CHARGE and SHOOT abilities even if they used a RETREAT ability in the same turn.

battleTraits.name: Da King's Guards
battleTraits.lore: Skragrott keeps a personal retinue of troggoths to protect him and favoured members of his court.
battleTraits.effect:
While a friendly TROGGOTH unit is within the combat range of a friendly HERO:

• That HERO has WARD (4+).
• Each time you make a successful ward roll for that HERO, allocate 1 damage point to a friendly TROGGOTH unit within that HERO’s combat range after the damage sequence for that HERO has been resolved (ward rolls cannot be made for those damage points).

battleTraits.name: Da Loonking's Court
battleTraits.lore: The vast hoards of looted treasure held in the deepest, darkest caverns of the Loonking’s empire are legendary.
battleTraits.declare: Pick up to D3 friendly non-UNIQUE KING’S GITZ HEROES that do not have an enhancement.
battleTraits.effect:
Give each HERO 1 enhancement from the ‘Da King’s Gitz’ Army of Renown rules.

Designer’s Note: These enhancements are given to the HEROES during the deployment phase, not during army composition.

battleTraits.name: The Moon and The Loon
battleTraits.lore: The Bad Moon’s gaze frequently falls upon the Loonking and his court.
battleTraits.effect:
While a friendly unit is wholly within 9" of a friendly Skragrott, a friendly Malevolent Moon or a friendly Bad Moon Loonshrine:

•  Add 5 to the control scores of friendly non-SQUIG MOONCLAN units.
•  Instead of rolling the dice to determine the Move characteristic of a friendly SQUIG unit, you can use a value of 4.

battleTraits.name: Herd Healing
battleTraits.lore: When troggoths gather in larger numbers, the sheer troggness of the herd serves as a catalyst for their regenerative abilities.
battleTraits.effect: Each time a friendly TROGGOTH unit uses a FIGHT ability, after that ability has been resolved, Heal (D3) that unit.

battleTraits.name: Moon-toughened Hide
battleTraits.lore: The light of the Bad Moon illuminates the troggoths’ craggy hides, its madcap magic rendering them even more resilient than usual.
battleTraits.effect: In battle rounds 2 and 3, subtract 1 from the Rend characteristic of melee weapons used for attacks that target friendly TRUGG’S TROGGHERD units.

battleTraits.name: Broken Slumber
battleTraits.lore: Disturbed by the approach of an enemy army, dozing troggoths – presumed till now to be part of the scenery – wake up in a blurry rage, fists and clubs swinging.
battleTraits.declare: Pick a friendly TRUGG’S TROGGHERD unit that is a living landmark.
battleTraits.effect: Set up that unit anywhere on the battlefield wholly within 3" of a terrain feature and more than 9" from all enemy units.

battleTraits.name: Living Landmark
battleTraits.lore: Despite their great size, when some troggoths lie down for a snooze, they are easy to mistake for just another part of the landscape…
battleTraits.declare: Pick a friendly TRUGG’S TROGGHERD unit that has not been deployed.
battleTraits.effect: Set up that unit in reserve as a living landmark. It has now been deployed.

battleTraits.name: Aura of Haywire Magic
battleTraits.lore: Those who trudge beside the Troggoth King on his long march are imbued with the same mysterious powers their liege unwittingly channels.
battleTraits.effect: The effects of a friendly Trugg’s ‘Malfunctioning Leystone’ ability affect friendly TRUGG’S TROGGHERD units anywhere on the battlefield instead of only those wholly within 12" of that friendly Trugg.

battleTraits.name: Dis Fight's Not Fer Me
battleTraits.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Enemy Combat Phase
battleTraits.lore: Gitmob grots are hard to pin down in combat, whether they are riding Snarlfangs or chariots - or just not up for a fight when the odds are against them.
battleTraits.declare: Pick a friendly DROGGZ'S GITMOB unit that is in combat with any enemy units that charged this turn and is not in combat with any enemy units that did not charge this turn to be the target.
battleTraits.effect: Roll a dice. On a 4+, the target can immediately use the 'Retreat' ability as if it were your movement phase.

battleTraits.name: Surprise, Ya Gitz!
battleTraits.lore: When the front lines are engaged, the Gitmob flanking forces launch their ambush.
battleTraits.declare: Pick a friendly DROGGZ’S GITMOB unit that is outflanking the enemy.
battleTraits.effect: Set up that unit on the battlefield wholly within 6" of a battlefield edge and more than 9" from all enemy units.

battleTraits.name: Glowering Light
battleTraits.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
battleTraits.lore: Those who are suddenly bathed in Glareface Frazzlegit’s light are momentarily stunned by his fearsome gloweriness.
battleTraits.declare: Pick an enemy unit in combat with a friendly DROGGZ’S GITMOB unit that has charged this turn to be the target.
battleTraits.effect: Roll a dice. On a 3+, for the rest of the turn, the target cannot make a pile-in move when it is picked to use a FIGHT ability.

battleTraits.name: Get Around 'Em
battleTraits.lore: With a cackle, groups of Gitmob grots race off into the distance to surround and outflank the foe.
battleTraits.declare: Pick a friendly DROGGZ’S GITMOB unit that has not been deployed.
battleTraits.effect: Set up that unit in reserve outflanking the enemy. It has now been deployed.
